channel.title: Behance Network Featured Projects
channel.description: The latest projects featured on the Behance Network

item.title: Microsoft Arc Touch Mouse
item.description: Final Mechanism Concept, with One & Co 2010, 2 months Credits: Jonah Becker, Claude Zellweger, Scott Croyle, Cory Worth, One & Co Team, Microsoft Industrial Design Team, Young Kim, Monique Chatterjee, Dave Zucker Project contribution: Final Mechanism Concept and Some Aesthetics Exploration together with One & Co. & Microsoft Team This was a project done for Microsoft while I was working at One & Co, San Francisco. Microsoft was looking for a way to get a mouse to flatten for travel and storage, while being ergonomically shaped during use. The project involved problem-solving, mechanism ideation and envisioning the resultant aesthetics of each possible mechanical solution. The key approach was to exhaust all possibilities to achieve the flat-to-arced transformation. My contribution of the bend-and-snap mechanism principle provided the solution Microsoft was looking for. Based on this proposed principle, Microsoft engineered the final version and took it through to production. The Arc Touch Mouse gathered the 2011 Red Dot Best of the Best Award and the 2011 IDSA IDEA Gold Award.
item.content:encoded: Final Mechanism Concept, with One & Co 2010, 2 months Credits: Jonah Becker, Claude Zellweger, Scott Croyle, Cory Worth, One & Co Team, Microsoft Industrial Design Team, Young Kim, Monique Chatterjee, Dave Zucker Project contribution: Final Mechanism Concept and Some Aesthetics Exploration together with One & Co. & Microsoft Team This was a project done for Microsoft while I was working at One & Co, San Francisco. Microsoft was looking for a way to get a mouse to flatten for travel and storage, while being ergonomically shaped during use. The project involved problem-solving, mechanism ideation and envisioning the resultant aesthetics of each possible mechanical solution. The key approach was to exhaust all possibilities to achieve the flat-to-arced transformation. My contribution of the bend-and-snap mechanism principle provided the solution Microsoft was looking for. Based on this proposed principle, Microsoft engineered the final version and took it through to production. The Arc Touch Mouse gathered the 2011 Red Dot Best of the Best Award and the 2011 IDSA IDEA Gold Award.

item.title: Cambodia by Moonlight
item.description: The MOONLIGHT, a solar powered lantern, is built and was designed in collaboration with the rural Cambodians it is made to serve. Over 70% of the country has no access to the power grid, so as a result they have traditionally relied on kerosene lamps after dark for tasks like cooking, eating and reading. Those lamps pose a great fire risk, as most rural homes are built from wood and straw. The MOONLIGHT can be rented in rural areas for less than $.08/day, the same amount traditionally spent on kerosene. These photos were taken in villages around Kandal Province, near the Mekong River, the first area to adapt the MOONLIGHT for everyday use.
item.content:encoded: The MOONLIGHT, a solar powered lantern, is built and was designed in collaboration with the rural Cambodians it is made to serve. Over 70% of the country has no access to the power grid, so as a result they have traditionally relied on kerosene lamps after dark for tasks like cooking, eating and reading. Those lamps pose a great fire risk, as most rural homes are built from wood and straw. The MOONLIGHT can be rented in rural areas for less than $.08/day, the same amount traditionally spent on kerosene. These photos were taken in villages around Kandal Province, near the Mekong River, the first area to adapt the MOONLIGHT for everyday use.

item.title: THE END OF GEOGRAPHY
item.description: "The Internet Age has been hailed as the end of geography. In fact, the internet has a geography of its own, a geography made of networks and nodes that process information flows generated and managed from places. It redefines distance but does not cancel geography". MANUEL CASTELS
item.content:encoded: "The Internet Age has been hailed as the end of geography. In fact, the internet has a geography of its own, a geography made of networks and nodes that process information flows generated and managed from places. It redefines distance but does not cancel geography". MANUEL CASTELS

item.title: TNG FASHION RIO SS 2012
item.description: Prints designed by Jonny Macali for TNG Fashion Rio SS2012 Inspirations: 90's, 60's in 90's, Clubbers, Concrete Art, Paul Klee Materials: PRENE mesh (mesh-like neoprene), cotton, denim, spandex hooded, trench coat and tricoline. Colors: indigo, pink, green and black water. Shapes: Straight and adjusted, with fluffy dresses and pants. General Director: Tito Bessa Jr. Style: Fabio Andreoni Styling: Mauricio Ianês Prints designed by Jonny Macali Beauty: Robert Stephen Photos: Courtesy of Marcio Madeira / First View © 2011 TNG
item.content:encoded: Prints designed by Jonny Macali for TNG Fashion Rio SS2012 Inspirations: 90's, 60's in 90's, Clubbers, Concrete Art, Paul Klee Materials: PRENE mesh (mesh-like neoprene), cotton, denim, spandex hooded, trench coat and tricoline. Colors: indigo, pink, green and black water. Shapes: Straight and adjusted, with fluffy dresses and pants. General Director: Tito Bessa Jr. Style: Fabio Andreoni Styling: Mauricio Ianês Prints designed by Jonny Macali Beauty: Robert Stephen Photos: Courtesy of Marcio Madeira / First View © 2011 TNG

item.title: H Wedding
item.description: To represent the union of the bride and groom, two vertical bars interweave and twist into a Hthe initials of both of their namessymbolizing their marriage. The symbol was applied onto a variety of objects in every way you can imagine. From on-screen animations as two bars playfully dancing and weaving together, hot-stamped onto cloth-bound books, blind embossed on invitations, engraved onto envelopes, and even on a fondant cake!
item.content:encoded: To represent the union of the bride and groom, two vertical bars interweave and twist into a Hthe initials of both of their namessymbolizing their marriage. The symbol was applied onto a variety of objects in every way you can imagine. From on-screen animations as two bars playfully dancing and weaving together, hot-stamped onto cloth-bound books, blind embossed on invitations, engraved onto envelopes, and even on a fondant cake!

item.title: Infomotor Tickr UI
item.description: In close collaboration with infomotor I developed the User Interface design for the new business software tickr. tickr makes it fast and easy to consume all kinds of business information - as it happens. tickr is a cloud-based platform that makes it easy to gather, integrate, and display custom business information.
item.content:encoded: In close collaboration with infomotor I developed the User Interface design for the new business software tickr. tickr makes it fast and easy to consume all kinds of business information - as it happens. tickr is a cloud-based platform that makes it easy to gather, integrate, and display custom business information.

item.title: Syfy House of Imagination
item.description: In commemoration of SCI FI's brand evolution to Syfy, the "House of Imagination" brand film invites viewers into a celebratory house party populated with rooms inspired by the Channel's original programs and characters. Production design was handled by adNAU partner Tino Schaedler with fellow adNAU partner Oliver Zeller joining on digital set design for the 2010 sequel.
item.content:encoded: In commemoration of SCI FI's brand evolution to Syfy, the "House of Imagination" brand film invites viewers into a celebratory house party populated with rooms inspired by the Channel's original programs and characters. Production design was handled by adNAU partner Tino Schaedler with fellow adNAU partner Oliver Zeller joining on digital set design for the 2010 sequel.

item.title: KangaROOS
item.description: Be Retro retrata la personalidad ochentera de la marca mezclando una explosión de colores, formas dinámicas y simbolismos gráficos que te transportan hacia los mismísimos 80s mostrando la esencia colorida llena de explosión de colores y diseños que alucinaran tu pupila. , la campaña trata de darle un valor agregado a la marca en cuanto a su personalidad relajada, libre y original. Para la campaña se usaron iconos de la época de los ochenta y se mezcló con colores de la época, todo esto se unifico en ilustración para crear un concepto sólido, impactante y sólido, eso es Be Retro.
item.content:encoded: Be Retro retrata la personalidad ochentera de la marca mezclando una explosión de colores, formas dinámicas y simbolismos gráficos que te transportan hacia los mismísimos 80s mostrando la esencia colorida llena de explosión de colores y diseños que alucinaran tu pupila. , la campaña trata de darle un valor agregado a la marca en cuanto a su personalidad relajada, libre y original. Para la campaña se usaron iconos de la época de los ochenta y se mezcló con colores de la época, todo esto se unifico en ilustración para crear un concepto sólido, impactante y sólido, eso es Be Retro.
